703648f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clinton Avenue - Lafayette Avenue
703648f-a.text:
34l Clinton Ave., east side, south of Lafayette Ave; showing the''Pouch
Gallery'.  This building was erected by Robert Graves in 1888 for his
home; William A. Mundell was the architect. Alfred J. Pouch, after purchas-
ing it, remodeled it to be suitable for assemblies and public gatherings.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703648f-a.folder: Clinton Avenue & Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703645f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clinton Avenue - Lafayette Avenue
703645f-a.text:
333, 329, 323 Clinton Avenue, at, adjoining and north of
the N.E. corner of Lafayette Avenue, showing three private
mansions in the Fort Greene Park section of the borough. View
2 shows the corner house, 333.
P. L. Sperr  October 12, 1940
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2
